alert.note: Alert for Eastern Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 4:13PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Litchfield and east central Dutchess Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 413 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kent, or 11 miles north of Sherman, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Torrington, Kent, Litchfield, Northwest Harwinton, New Preston, Cornwall Bridge, Wingdale, Dover Plains, Gaylordsville, Winsted, Harwinton, Goshen, Warren, Cornwall, Bantam, South Norfolk, West Torrington, Torringford, Haight Vineyard and Mooreville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
